name: David Letterman
monologue: I always like going out for dinner on Valentine’s Day — until the part when you have to divide the check.

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Restaurants That Still Have Reservations Available For Valentine’s Day

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Egypt’s President Mubarak finally resigned. When they heard that a Muslim president stepped down, the tea party said, “Obama’s leaving?”

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Before her latest brush with the law, Lindsay Lohan planned to open a jewelry store. If Charlie Sheen can have rehab at home, Lindsay Lohan can open a jewelry store.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: In court, the judge told Lindsay Lohan that she is “no different from anyone else.” How does that make us feel?

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Keith Olbermann has a new job on Al Gore’s Current TV as an investigative reporter. His job will be to find anyone that watches Current TV.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: I don’t know what to think about the whole mess in Egypt. Some people say Egypt will never be a democracy. On the other hand, Justin Bieber says, “never say never.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A restaurant in London has started serving aged steaks infused with collagen. Or as Bravo calls that, “The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: It’s rumored that Lindsay Lohan and her mom are opening a clothing and jewelry boutique. It will be located on the inside of Lindsay’s overcoat.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: JWoww from “Jersey Shore” walked the runway yesterday during a designer’s fashion show. Meanwhile, Snooki walked the runway after she got drunk and wandered off at the airport.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Justin Bieber is doing really well right now. Nothing can stop him — except maybe puberty.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Justin Bieber is Canadian, and so is Celine Dion and William Shatner. It makes me wonder: Are we guarding the wrong border?

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: The whole world has Bieber fever. It’s what happens whenever a pop frenzy becomes a disease. There was also Beatle Mania, the Miley Cyrus Virus, and the Hasselhoff Cough.
